description: Data for Minecraft Java Edition addons.

ModelDisplayPosition.description: Place where an item model is displayed. Holds its rotation, translation and scale for the specified situation. fixed refers to item frames, while the rest are as their name states. Note that translations are applied to the model before rotations.

rotation.description: Specifies the rotation of the model according to the scheme [x, y, z].

translation.description: Specifies the position of the model according to the scheme [x, y, z]. If the value is greater than 80, it is displayed as 80. If the value is less than -80, it is displayed as -80.

scale.description: Specifies the scale of the model according to the scheme [x, y, z]. If the value is greater than 4, it is displayed as 4.

uv.description: Defines the area of the texture to use according to the scheme [x1, y1, x2, y2]. If unset, it defaults to values equal to xyz position of the element. The texture behavior is inconsistent if UV extends below 0 or above 16. If the numbers of x1 and x2 are swapped (e.g. from 0, 0, 16, 16 to 16, 0, 0, 16), the texture flips. UV is optional, and if not supplied it automatically generates based on the element's position.

texture.description: Specifies the texture in form of the texture variable prepended with a #.

cullface.description: Specifies whether a face does not need to be rendered when there is a block touching it in the specified position. The position can be: down, up, north, south, west, or east. It also determines the side of the block to use the light level from for lighting the face, and if unset, defaults to the side.

rotation.description: Rotates the texture by the specified number of degrees. Can be 0, 90, 180, or 270. Defaults to 0. Rotation does not affect which part of the texture is used. Instead, it amounts to permutation of the selected texture vertexes (selected implicitly, or explicitly though uv).

tintindex.description: Determines whether to tint the texture using a hardcoded tint index. The default is not using the tint, and any number causes it to use tint. Note that only certain blocks have a tint index; all others are unaffected.

min.description: type=uniform Number provider. The minimum value.

max.description: type=uniform Number provider. The maximum value.

n.description: type=binomial Number provider. The amount of trials.

p.description: type=binomial Number provider. The probability of success on an individual trial.

target.description: type=score Scoreboard name provider. One of `this`, `killer`, `direct_killer`, `player_killer`.
type=context Scoreboard name provider. One of this, killer, direct_killer, player_killer.

scale.description: type=score Optional. Scale to multiply the score before returning it.

credit.description: Credit to the creator of this file.

parent.description: Loads a different model from the given path, in form of namespaced ID. If both "parent" and "elements" are set, the "elements" tag overrides the "elements" tag from the previous model.

display.description: Holds the different places where item models are displayed.

head.description: 3rd person when the item is in the head slot.

ground.description: The dropped item on the ground.

fixed.description: The item in a item frame.

textures.description: Holds the textures of the model, in form of namespaced ID or can be another texture variable.

additionalProperties.description: Defines a texture variable and assigns a texture.

particle.description: What texture to load particles from. This texture is used if you are in a nether portal. Note: All breaking particles from non-model blocks are hard-coded. What texture to load particles from. Used to determine the "crumb" particles generated by food items, as well as to determine the barrier particle (but it always uses items/barrier.png as blockbreaking particle), which otherwise uses "layer0".

layer0.description: Only used to specify the icon of the item used in the inventory. There can be more than just one layer (e.g. for spawn eggs), but the amount of possible layers is hardcoded for each item. Works only in combination with "builtin/generated".

layer1.description: Only used to specify the icon of the item used in the inventory. There can be more than just one layer (e.g. for spawn eggs), but the amount of possible layers is hardcoded for each item. Works only in combination with "builtin/generated".

elements.description: Contains all the elements of the model. They can have only cubic forms. If both "parent" and "elements" are set, the "elements" tag overrides the "elements" tag from the previous model.

from.description: Start point of a cube according to the scheme [x, y, z]. Values must be between -16 and 32.

to.description: Stop point of a cube according to the scheme [x, y, z]. Values must be between -16 and 32.

rotation.description: Defines the rotation of an element.

origin.description: Sets the center of the rotation according to the scheme [x, y, z].

axis.description: Specifies the direction of rotation, can be "x", "y" or "z".

angle.description: Specifies the angle of rotation. Can be 45 through -45 degrees in 22.5 degree increments.

rescale.description: Specifies whether or not to scale the faces across the whole block. Can be true or false. Defaults to false.

faces.description: Holds all the faces of the cube. If a face is left out, it does not render.

north.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

south.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

east.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

west.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

up.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

down.description: Contains the properties of the specified face.

gui_light.description: Can be "front" or "side". If set to "side", the model is rendered like a block. If set to "front", model is shaded like a flat item.

overrides.description: Determines cases in which a different model should be used based on item tags. All cases are evaluated in order from top to bottom and last predicate that matches overrides. However, overrides are ignored if it has been already overridden once, for example this avoids recursion on overriding to the same model.

angle.description: Used on compasses to determine the current angle, expressed in a decimal value of less than one.

blocking.description: Used on shields to determine if currently blocking. If 1, the player is blocking.

broken.description: Used on Elytra to determine if broken. If 1, the Elytra is broken.

cast.description: Used on fishing rods to determine if the fishing rod has been cast. If 1, the fishing rod has been cast.

cooldown.description: Used on ender pearls and chorus fruit to determine the remaining cooldown, expressed in a decimal value between 0 and 1.

damage.description: Used on items with durability to determine the amount of damage, expressed in a decimal value between 0 and 1.

damaged.description: Used on items with durability to determine if it is damaged. If 1, the item is damaged. Note that if an item has the unbreakable tag, this may be 0 while the item has a non-zero "damage" tag.

lefthanded.description: Determines the model used by left handed players. It affects the item they see in inventories, along with the item players see them holding or wearing.

pull.description: Determines the amount a bow or crossbow has been pulled, expressed in a decimal value of less than one.

pulling.description: Used on bows and crossbows to determine if the bow is being pulled. If 1, the bow is currently being pulled.

charged.description: Used on crossbows to determine if they are charged with any projectile. If 1, the crossbow is charged

firework.description: Used on crossbows. If 1, the crossbow is charged with a firework rocket.

throwing.description: Used on the trident to determine if the trident is ready to be thrown by the player. If 1, the trident is ready for fire.

time.description: Used on clocks to determine the current time, expressed in a decimal value of less than one.

custom_model_data.description: Used on any item and is compared to the tag.CustomModelData NBT, expressed in an integer value. The number is still internally converted to float, causing a precision loss for some numbers above 16 million. If the value read from the item data is greater than or equal to the value used for the predicate, the predicate is positive.

model.description: The path to the model to use if the case is met, in form of namespaced ID.

type.description: Optional type of the loot table.

functions.description: Applies functions to all item stacks produced by this table. Functions are applied in order, so for example `looting_enchant` must be after `set_count` to work correctly.

function.description: Namespaced ID of the function to apply.

enchantment.description: Enchantment ID used for level calculation.

formula.description: Can be binomial_with_bonus_count for a binomial distribution (with n=level + extra, p=probability), uniform_bonus_count for uniform distribution (from 0 to level * bonusMultiplier), or ore_drops for a special function used for ore drops in the vanilla game (Count * (max(0; random(0..Level + 2) - 1)+1)).

source.description: Needs to be set to `block_entity` for `copy_name`. Specifies the source. Set to block_entity for the block entity of the destroyed block, this to use the entity that died or the player that gained the advancement, opened the container or broke the block, killer for the killer, or killer_player for a killer that is a player.
type=storage A resource location specifying the storage ID.
The nbt path to copy from.

target.description: The nbt path to copy to, starting from the item's `tag` tag.

op.description: Can be `replace` to replace any existing contents of the target, `append` to append to a list, or `merge` to merge into a compound tag.

block.description: A block ID. Function fails if the block doesn't match

properties.description: A list of property names to copy.

items.description: A block state name to copy.

anyOf.description: List of enchantment IDs to choose from. If omitted, all enchantments applicable to the item are possible.

minecraft:aqua_affinity.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:bane_of_arthropods.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:binding_curse.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:blast_protection.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:channeling.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:depth_strider.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:efficiency.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:feather_falling.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:fire_aspect.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:fire_protection.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:flame.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:fortune.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:frost_walker.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:impaling.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:infinity.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:knockback.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:looting.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:loyalty.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:luck_of_the_sea.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:lure.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:mending.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:multishot.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:piercing.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:power.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:projectile_protection.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:protection.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:punch.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:quick_charge.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:respiration.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:riptide.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:sharpness.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:silk_touch.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:smite.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:soul_speed.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:sweeping.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:thorns.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:unbreaking.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

minecraft:vanishing_curse.description: Number provider specifying the enchantment level.

treasure.description: Determines whether treasure enchantments are allowed on

levels.description: Number provider. Specifies the exact enchantment level to use.

destination.description: The type of generated structure to locate. Accepts any of the StructureTypes used by the /locate command (case insensitive)

decoration.description: The icon used to mark the destination on the map. Accepts any of the map icon text IDs (case insensitive). If `mansion` or `monument` is used, the color of the lines on the item texture changes to match the corresponding explorer map.

zoom.description: The zoom level of the resulting map. Defaults to 2.

search_radius.description: The size, in chunks, of the area to search for structures. The area checked is square, not circular. Radius 0 causes only the current chunk to be searched, radius 1 causes the current chunk and eight adjacent chunks to be searched, and so on. Defaults to 50.

entity.description: Specifies an entity to be used for the player head. Set to this to use the entity that died or the player that gained the advancement, opened the container or broke the block, killer for the killer, or killer_player for a killer that is a player.

limit.description: Number provider. Specifies the number of additional items per level of looting. Note the number may be fractional, rounded after multiplying by the looting level.

count.description: Specifies the number of additional items per level of looting. Note the number may be fractional, rounded after multiplying by the looting level. Specifies the stack size to set.

attribute.description: The name of the attribute this modifier is to act upon.

amount.description: Number provider. Specifies the amount of the modifier.

id.description: Optional : UUID of the modifier following. If none specified, a new UUID is generated.

slot.description: Slots the item must be in for the modifier to take effect, this value can be one of the following : "mainhand", "offhand", "feet", "legs", "chest", or "head".

color.description: The color for this pattern. One of `white`, `orange`, `magenta`, `light_blue`, `yellow`, `lime`, `pink`, `gray`, `light_gray`, `cyan`, `purple`, `blue`, `brown`, `green`, `red`, `black`.

append.description: Optional. If true, new patterns will be appended to existing ones.

entries.description: The entries to use as contents.

add.description: Optional. If `true`, change will be relative to current count/damage.

damage.description: Number provider. Specifies the damage fraction to set (1.0 is undamaged, 0.0 is zero durability left).

anyOf.description: function=set_loot_table Specifies the resource location of the loot table to be used.
function=set_name A JSON text component name, allowing color, translations, etc.

seed.description: Optional. Specifies the loot table seed. If absent or set to 0, a random seed will be used.

lore.description: List of JSON text components. Each list entry represents one line of the lore.

tag.description: Tag string to add, similar to those used by commands. Note that the first bracket is required and quotation marks need to be escaped using a backslash (\)

set_stew_effect.description: Sets the status effects for suspicious stew.

duration.description: Number provider. The duration of the effect.

conditions.description: Determines conditions for this function to be applied. If multiple conditions are specified, all must pass.

terms.description: A list of conditions to join using 'or'.

block.description: A block ID. The test fails if the block doesn't match.

properties.description: (Optional) A map of block property names to values. All values are strings. The test fails if the block doesn't match.

predicate.description: Predicate applied to the damage source.

bypasses_armor.description: Checks if the damage bypassed the armor of the player (suffocation damage predominantly).

bypasses_invulnerability.description: Checks if the damage bypassed the invulnerability status of the player (void or /kill damage).

bypasses_magic.description: Checks if the damage was caused by starvation.

is_explosion.description: Checks if the damage originated from an explosion.

is_fire.description: Checks if the damage originated from fire.

is_magic.description: Checks if the damage originated from magic.

is_projectile.description: Checks if the damage originated from a projectile.

is_lightning.description: Checks if the damage originated from lightning.

direct_entity.description: The entity that was the direct cause of the damage.

ambient.description: Whether the effect is from a beacon.

visible.description: Whether the effect has visible particles.

is_on_fire.description: Test whether the entity is or is not on fire.

is_sneaking.description: Test whether the entity is or is not sneaking.

is_sprinting.description: Test whether the entity is or is not sprinting.

is_swimming.description: Test whether the entity is or is not swimming.

is_baby.description: Test whether the entity is or is not a baby variant.

state.description: A map of block property names to values. Test will fail if the block doesn't match.

dimension.description: The dimension the entity is currently in.

state.description: A map of fluid property names to values. Test will fail if the fluid doesn't match.

light.description: The light Level of visible light. Calculated using: (max(sky-darkening,block)).

smokey.description: True if the block is closely above a campfire or soul campfire.

player.description: Player properties to be checked. Fails when entity is not a player.

additionalProperties.description: A criteria ID of the advancement.

gamemode.description: The game mode of the player. Must be survival, adventure, creative or spectator.

level.description: The experience level of the player.

recipes.description: A map of recipes to check.

additionalProperties.description: A recipe ID. True if the recipe is known to the player.

stat.description: The statistic ID. Mostly mimics the criteria used for defining scoreboard objectives.

team.description: The team the entity belongs to.

targeted_entity.description: The entity which this entity is targeting for attacks.

vehicle.description: The vehicle that the entity is riding on.

source_entity.description: Checks the entity that was the source of the damage (for example: The skeleton that shot the arrow).

entity.description: Specifies the entity to check for the condition. Set to this to use the entity that died or the player that gained the advancement, opened the container or broke the block, killer for the killer, or killer_player for a killer that is a player.

scores.description: Scores to check. All specified scores must pass for the condition to pass.

additionalProperties.description: Key name is the objective while the value is the exact score value required for the condition to pass.

inverse.description: If true, the condition passes if killer_player is not available.

looting_multiplier.description: Looting adjustment to the base success rate. Formula is chance + (looting_level * looting_multiplier)

name.description: The namespaced ID of the condition (predicate) referred to. A cyclic reference causes a parsing failure.

chances.description: List of probabilities for enchantment level, indexed from 0.

period.description: If present, time gets modulo-divided by this value (for example, if set to 24000, value operates on a time period of daytime ticks just like /time query daytime).

raining.description: If true, the condition evaluates to true only if it's raining.

thundering.description: If true, the condition evaluates to true only if it's thundering.

range.description: The range to check the value.

pools.description: A list of all pools for this loot table. Each pool used generates items from its list of items based on the number of rolls. Pools are applied in

rolls.description: Number Provider. Specifies the number of rolls on the pool.

bonus_rolls.description: Number Provider. Specifies the number of bonus rolls on the pool per point of luck. Rounded down after multiplying.

entries.description: A list of all things that can be produced by this pool. One entry is chosen per roll as a weighted random selection from all entries without failing conditions.

type.description: Namespaced ID type of entry. Can be `item` for item entries, `tag` for item tags, `loot_table` to produce items from another loot table, `group` for child entries, `alternatives` to select one sub-entry from a list, `sequence` to select sub-entries until one entry cannot be granted, `dynamic` to generate block specific drops, or `empty` for an entry that generates nothing.

name.description:
For type 'item', ID name of the item to be produced, e.g. diamond. The default, if not changed by functions, is a stack of 1 of the default instance of the item.
For type 'tag' item tag to be used, e.g. arrows.
For type 'loot_table', loot table to be used, e.g. gameplay/fishing/junk.
For type 'dynamic', can be contents for block entity contents or self for banners and player skulls.

children.description:
For type 'group' a list of entries that are used to generate loot. Can be used for convenience, e.g. if one condition applies for multiple entries.
For type 'alternatives' a list of entries of which the first, and only the first, successful entry gets generated.
For type 'sequence' a list of entries that are used until the first entry fails. After an entry fails, no more entries of this list are generated

expand.description: For type 'tag', if set to true, it chooses one item of the tag, each with the same weight and quality. If false, it generates one of each of the items in the tag. Required when type is 'tag'.

weight.description: Determines how often this entry is chosen out of all the entries in the pool. Entries with higher weights are used more often (chance is this entry's weight⁄total of all considered entries' weights).

quality.description: Modifies the entry's weight based on the killing/opening/fishing player's luck attribute. Formula is floor( weight + (quality * generic.luck)).
